title: Configure Super Admin with Full Access Rights - Frontend Implementation

requirements.summary: Update AdminGuard component to handle super admin authentication flow and display appropriate messaging
acceptanceCriteria: Component correctly identifies when logged-in user is the super admin
Admin dashboard becomes accessible immediately after super admin authentication
No access denied message appears for the super admin principal

file_operations.description: Add console logging to track authentication flow and admin status checks. Log the current principal ID, the result of isCallerAdmin backend check, and any authorization failures. Display loading states appropriately while checking super admin status. Ensure the component grants immediate access when the backend confirms super admin role without showing access denied messages.

requirements.summary: Add console logging throughout the super admin configuration process for debugging
acceptanceCriteria: Frontend logs display the authenticated principal and admin check results
Error logs provide clear information if super admin setup fails

file_operations.description: Add console logging to useIsCallerAdmin hook to capture the principal ID being checked, the backend response (true/false), and any errors during the admin verification process. Log before making the backend call and after receiving the response.

Add console logging to capture the authenticated principal ID when the actor is initialized and when authentication state changes. Log any errors during actor initialization or authentication failures that could prevent super admin setup.

Add console logging in the authentication flow to track login/logout events, including the principal ID of the logged-in user. Log when authentication succeeds, when it fails, and when the user logs out. This helps debug the super admin authentication process end-to-end.
